Title: DATA SCIENTIST – ANALYTICS BANKING
Description:
NTT Data somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 139.000 profesionales, tan diverso cómo diversos son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad; telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energía, administración pública y sanidad.




¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.




Descripción de la oferta




NTT DATA busca un perfil de Data Scientist para integrarse a proyectos de analítica avanzada en el sector bancario. Participarás en el desarrollo de soluciones predictivas desde la exploración de datos hasta la validación de modelos en problemas reales como churn, scoring o segmentación.




¿Qué buscamos?




Formación:




Grado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Física, Ingeniería o similares.
Se valorará máster o bootcamp en Ciencia de Datos.




Experiencia:




Hasta 2 años en proyectos de ciencia de datos o investigaciones aplicadas.
Se valorará participación en hackathons, Kaggle o proyectos propios.




Conocimientos




Requerido:




Programación en Python para análisis y ML (pandas, scikit-learn, matplotlib).
Fundamentos de estadística y aprendizaje supervisado.
SQL básico para extracción de datos.
Conocimientos básicos en validación de modelos.
Inglés intermedio o avanzado.




Valorado:




Familiaridad con entornos AWS (S3, SageMaker, Athena).
Conocimiento básico en visualización de resultados con Power BI o Tableau.
Primeros pasos en pipelines o notebooks colaborativos.




Deseable:




Interés por herramientas de IA Generativa y nuevas tendencias en ciencia de datos.
Experiencia en data wrangling con PySpark o pandas avanzados.

Soft Skills




Curiosidad y mentalidad resolutiva.
Capacidad para aprender rápido y adaptarse a nuevos entornos.
Pensamiento estructurado.
Comunicación clara con equipos multidisciplinares.

¿Qué te ofrecemos?




Te ofrecemos la incorporación a una compañía que marca la diferencia estando cerca de nuestros clientes, superando las expectativas, gestionando proactivamente nuestros proyectos y a nuestros clientes y centrándonos en la calidad a través de la selección de los empleados con la mentalidad adecuada para asegurar nuestro crecimiento.




Más allá del alcance de tu responsabilidad directa, formarás parte de la práctica de Business Consulting en la que te encontrarás con un equipo dinámico, joven, entusiasta y siempre orientado hacia el éxito, a partir de una fuerte cultura emprendedora pero, sobre todo, de un gran ambiente de trabajo, en el que todos formamos parte de un proyecto compartido, y en el que todos somos importantes.




Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.




#WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Show more
HTML:
NTT Data somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 139.000 profesionales, tan diverso cómo diversos son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad; telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energía, administración pública y sanidad.


¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.


Descripción de la oferta


NTT DATA busca un perfil de Data Scientist para integrarse a proyectos de analítica avanzada en el sector bancario. Participarás en el desarrollo de soluciones predictivas desde la exploración de datos hasta la validación de modelos en problemas reales como churn, scoring o segmentación.


¿Qué buscamos?


Formación:


  • Grado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Física, Ingeniería o similares.
  • Se valorará máster o bootcamp en Ciencia de Datos.


Experiencia:


  • Hasta 2 años en proyectos de ciencia de datos o investigaciones aplicadas.
  • Se valorará participación en hackathons, Kaggle o proyectos propios.


Conocimientos


Requerido:


  • Programación en Python para análisis y ML (pandas, scikit-learn, matplotlib).
  • Fundamentos de estadística y aprendizaje supervisado.
  • SQL básico para extracción de datos.
  • Conocimientos básicos en validación de modelos.
  • Inglés intermedio o avanzado.


Valorado:


  • Familiaridad con entornos AWS (S3, SageMaker, Athena).
  • Conocimiento básico en visualización de resultados con Power BI o Tableau.
  • Primeros pasos en pipelines o notebooks colaborativos.


Deseable:


  • Interés por herramientas de IA Generativa y nuevas tendencias en ciencia de datos.
  • Experiencia en data wrangling con PySpark o pandas avanzados.

Soft Skills


  • Curiosidad y mentalidad resolutiva.
  • Capacidad para aprender rápido y adaptarse a nuevos entornos.
  • Pensamiento estructurado.
  • Comunicación clara con equipos multidisciplinares.

¿Qué te ofrecemos?


Te ofrecemos la incorporación a una compañía que marca la diferencia estando cerca de nuestros clientes, superando las expectativas, gestionando proactivamente nuestros proyectos y a nuestros clientes y centrándonos en la calidad a través de la selección de los empleados con la mentalidad adecuada para asegurar nuestro crecimiento.


Más allá del alcance de tu responsabilidad directa, formarás parte de la práctica de Business Consulting en la que te encontrarás con un equipo dinámico, joven, entusiasta y siempre orientado hacia el éxito, a partir de una fuerte cultura emprendedora pero, sobre todo, de un gran ambiente de trabajo, en el que todos formamos parte de un proyecto compartido, y en el que todos somos importantes.


Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.


#WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

At Planner 5D we are searching for a Senior Python Engineer who will join our team and will be building production-ready systems that directly support our product.

Responsibilities:


Design, build, and maintain scalable services that support the AI lifecycle, working closely with the research team to translate cutting-edge ideas into production-ready solutions
Develop tools for pre/post-processing data for AI and other usage
Develop tools for collecting and processing data
Design scalable pipelines for data collection, processing, and transformation powering next-generation AI systems
Bring new models and features to production at scale with Triton Inference Server, ONNX, and TensorRT
Work across the spectrum from rapid MVPs and experimental prototypes to robust, long-term production-grade solutions
Work closely with ChatGPT API, LangChain



Required knowledge of:


Proficient in Python as the primary language with strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to design, deploy, and manage scalable backend platforms in production
Understanding Docker and Kubernetes concepts
Practical experience managing challenges throughout the AI/ML lifecycle, from deployment and orchestration to model management
Ability to translate complex business domains into software models using Domain-Driven Design, supported by SOLID and clean coding practices
Ability to adapt quickly, learn new tools, and work independently on complex problems
Computer Science or Math degree
English Intermediate+



Would be a plus:


Experience with algorithms, data structures and graphs
Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Kotlin, Java)
Deep experience in mathematics (especially linear algebra), geometry, computer vision
Understanding of 2D / 3D technologies and software (for example OpenGL, WebGL, Raytracing, Blender)



What we offer:


Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
Company computer equipment by request
Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
English classes on our corporate platform
Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions



Note: We only consider applications from candidates currently based in locations: Lithuania or Netherlands. Visa sponsorship is available if you hold primary residence with work authorization.
Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - (Logistics, Optimization)
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are looking for a (Senior) Machine Learning Engineer to join the Logistics Optimization team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The Optimization Tribe's purpose is to maximize Delivery Hero's logistics performance. We achieve this by owning and continuously improving the sophisticated algorithm that solves the real-time vehicle routing problem, assigning orders efficiently every minute. This directly impacts DH's core efficiency and customer satisfaction KPIs, influencing decisions for stakeholders from Operations to Product.

As an ML Engineer, your value lies in tackling the problems at scale head-on and building ML products which shape the algorithm's logic and decisions to meet our long-term goals of best-in-class efficiency and service, making a tangible impact across the Delivery Hero network. Are you ready to take your Machine Learning Engineering skills to the next level and make a tangible impact on millions of users worldwide?

In this role you will,


Build the infrastructure that powers critical model inputs fed every minute to the dispatch algorithm which shapes experiences for millions of customers across the globe, every single day.
Design , build and maintain a scalable ML infrastructure to manage the entire ML lifecycle at scale.
Develop Tooling: Build and enhance ML engineering tooling for Model Development, Model Workbench, Model Training, Model monitoring, and Model serving.
Collaborate and Optimize: Work closely with data scientists, analysts and data engineers to understand their needs and build solutions that optimize their workflows.
Leverage Cloud: Utilize modern technologies and public cloud infrastructure to build highly available systems for multiple teams.
Scale and Perform: Build solutions at scale, optimizing for performance and efficiency.
Address Pain Points: Understand the pain points of application teams and translate them into robust platform features.
Innovate and Suggest: Proactively suggest how the team can leverage new technologies and architectures to support new use cases.


Qualifications


Software Engineering Expertise: At least 4 years of experience in software engineering with hands-on experience with modern programming languages such as Python, Java, or Golang.
Technical Evaluation: Experience in tech explorations to evaluate technologies for business problems and proposing solutions based on comprehensive pros and cons analysis.
Proof of Concept: Prior experience building proof of concepts for solving system design challenges using open-source tools.
Application Development: Experience building new applications from scratch.
System Analysis: Experience in deep-diving into existing systems for investigations and improvements.
ML Engineering Experience: Prior experience in ML engineering or MLOps.
Communication Skills: Fluency in English. Clarity in communication, both written and verbal.


Nice to Have


Prior knowledge of public cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud or equivalent).
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform or equivalent).
Familiarity with the ML engineering ecosystem, such as Model serving, training, and feature engineering pipelines.
Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools like Docker, Kubernetes, and Helm.
Experience with ML tools like Metaflow, MLflow, Argo Workflows, and Cloud Notebooks.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
I'm partnered with a large manufacturing company based around the Randstad region hiring for a Data Scientist.




Working closely with cross-functional teams, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling to extract insights, solve complex problems, and inform decision-making. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic scale-up company at the forefront of ethical AI innovation.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
Apply advanced statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms to analyze data and extract actionable insights.
Stay current with the latest research and developments in the fields of data science, machine learning, and AI ethics, and contribute to the company's knowledge base and best practices.
Adhere to ethical principles and guidelines in the development and deployment of AI systems, ensuring fairness, transparency, and accountability.




Qualifications:

Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field with a focus on data analysis and machine learning.
3+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist or a similar role, preferably in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java, as well as experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn).
Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work independently as well as part of a multidisciplinary team.
Passion for ethical AI and a commitment to promoting fairness, transparency, and accountability in AI systems.




Benefits:

Gross salary: €80,000+
Company Car + fuel card.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
A supportive and inclusive work environment that values diversity, equity, and inclusion.




Feel free to contact for more details:

Email: daniel.zelnis@vividresourcing.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
HCLTech is a global technology company, home to more than 220,755 + people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud, and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products. We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG, and Public Services. Consolidated revenues as of 12 months ending December 2024 totaled $13.8 billion.







Position Overview: The position requires a quality-focused and detail-oriented Data Scientist with a demonstrated track record of providing solutions for high-priority business goals and strategic management decisions. The incumbent should be a skilled troubleshooter and problem solver with the ability to translate business processes and problem statements into requirements. The incumbent must be able to deliver results within tight timelines







Essential Job Functions:

• Responsible for creating, and maintaining, conceptual, logical, and physical data models defining business requirements for management and business intelligence purpose

• Extensive experience in mapping data elements for ETL purposes

• Optimize and update logical and physical data models to support new and existing projects

• Experience in generating physical DDL to deploy to databases

• Analyze data-related system integration challenges and propose appropriate solutions

• Guide System Analysts, Engineers, Programmers and others on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfaces




Educational Qualifications and Experience:







Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance, Statistics, Data Science, or Mathematics.
Design and manage Power BI dashboards that convert data into clear, compelling visual narratives tailored for leadership and stakeholders.
Use statistical techniques to uncover trends, measure impact, and generate evidence-based recommendations related to change adoption.
Translate survey and feedback data quantitative and qualitative, into clear, actionable insights for reporting and continuous improvement.
Collaborate with the Transformation Data Lead and Organizational Change Management team to define and report on key adoption metrics: Setting baselines, tracking Adoption and Speed of Adoption – how quickly users begin adopting changes. Ultimate Utilization – the proportion of users consistently using the solution.
Proficiency – how well users perform in the new environment.
Work within an Agile Frameworks (e.g., SAFe, Scrum, Kanban):Understanding and applying Agile principles in transformation contexts. Support the development of automated, scalable data pipelines.
Use of Databricks for building analytics solutions is a plus.
Ensure consistency, accuracy, and usability of data across transformation efforts.
Communicate findings effectively through concise summaries, visual reports, and strategic recommendations tailored for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Skills Technical skills include knowledge of database languages such as SQL or Python. Proficiency in Power BI and Excel for dashboard development and reporting.
Knowledge of Databricks for pipeline development and analytics is a plus.
Proven ability to translate content, metrics, and feedback into actionable outcomes and practical insights.
Familiarity with change management adoption concepts and metrics (e.g., speed of adoption, utilization, proficiency).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate clearly across all levels, both technical and non-technical.
SAFE Agile certification is a plus.




What we offer:




• Competitive salary and performance bonuses

• Social benefits package

• Additional health insurance

• Referral bonus

• Learning hub

• Team buildings and company events

• Career growth







HCLTech provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by state or local laws.







Are you willing to build up your career with us? - We’ll be happy to receive your resume in English!







*Your personal data is secure with us.

** Only candidates selected for interview will be contacted

Title: Junior Data Scientist | Big Data & Advanced Analytics (Milano-Roma)
Description:
Junior Data Scientist – Big Data & Advanced Analytics




Sede: Milano - Roma (Ibrido)

Azienda: Be Management Consulting

Settore: Consulenza direzionale e IT per il settore bancario




CHI CERCHIAMO

Siamo alla ricerca di un Junior Data Scientist con una forte passione per l’Intelligenza Artificiale e il Machine Learning. Cerchiamo una persona curiosa, proattiva e desiderosa di mettersi in gioco, imparare sul campo e crescere rapidamente in un ambiente dinamico e innovativo.




COSA FARAI

Supporto all’analisi e modellazione dati: collaborerai allo sviluppo di modelli di Machine Learning e AI, affiancato da profili più senior.
Sviluppo algoritmi e sperimentazione: parteciperai all’implementazione per l’elaborazione e l’interpretazione dei dati, contribuendo alla trasformazione digitale delle aziende.
Big Data & Advanced Analytics: contribuirai all’analisi di dataset complessi nel settore finanziario.
Data Visualization: realizzerai dashboard e report sotto la guida di figure esperte per rendere i dati facilmente comprensibili agli stakeholder.
Formazione continua: imparerai a lavorare in team multidisciplinari, sperimentando tecnologie e approcci innovativi.




REQUISITI

Formazione: Laurea Magistrale o PHD in Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria o discipline affini.
Esperienza: 0–2 anni in ambito Data Science / AI / Advanced Analytics (anche tirocini o progetti universitari rilevanti).
Competenze tecniche Conoscenza di Python (o alternativamente R, Matlab, SPSS, SAS), SQL e strumenti di analisi statistica. Familiarità con ambienti cloud (preferibilmente Azure).
Soft Skills: Forte motivazione, spirito di iniziativa, voglia di imparare, capacità di lavorare in team e affrontare nuove sfide.
Lingue: Ottima conoscenza dell’inglese scritto e parlato.
Tool: Interesse per strumenti di Data Visualization e BI







CHI SIAMO

Be | Shaping the Future, parte del gruppo Engineering, è tra i principali player in ambito Management Consulting e ICT Solutions. Forniamo servizi di Business Advisory, Information Technology e Digital Engagement, supportando primarie istituzioni finanziarie e industriali nelle loro sfide di trasformazione digitale. Con circa 2.000 dipendenti e una presenza internazionale, il Gruppo è un punto di riferimento nel settore Financial Services.

Be Management Consulting è la società del Gruppo Be | Shaping the Future specializzata in Business Advisory. Supportiamo i nostri clienti nella gestione di progetti complessi con un approccio tailor-made, combinando competenze specialistiche e capacità di orchestrare soluzioni end-to-end.




COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Flessibilità: Sede a Milano con ampia possibilità di smart working.
Formazione continua: Accesso a corsi interni ed esterni per lo sviluppo professionale.
Feedback & crescita: Valutazioni periodiche basate sul merito e contatto diretto con il senior management.
Percorso di carriera dinamico: Crescita rapida in un ambiente giovane e imprenditoriale.




Durante il colloquio risponderemo a tutte le tue curiosità su Be e su come puoi fare la differenza.

Let’s shape our future together!




“I dati che Lei ci fornirà saranno raccolti dalla società Be Shaping the Future S.p.A. in quanto esclusivamente finalizzati alle attività di ricerca e selezione del personale, per posizioni aperte attuali e future, per un potenziale inserimento all’ interno delle singole società del gruppo Be: Be Shaping the Future S.p.A., Be Shaping the Future Management Consulting S.p. A., Be Shaping the Future Corporate Services S.p.A., Be Shaping the Future DigiTech Solutions S.p.A., IQUII Srl, Tesla Consulting Srl, Dream Of Ordinary Madness Entertainment S.r.l, Be Your Essence S.r.L , Be Poland Think, Solve & Execute Sp. z o. o., iBe Think Solve, Execute Ltd., targit GmbH, Be Think, Solve, Execute RO s.r.l., Be Ukraine Think, Solve, Execute LLC., nonché di ogni altra società appartenente al Gruppo Be. Per quanto non espressamente previsto in questo annuncio si rinvia all’Informativa privacy di Gruppo https://www.be-tse.it/it/ della quale l’interessato dichiara di aver preso visione condividendone il contenuto”.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Se procuras uma empresa inovadora, entusiasta e com visão de futuro, focada no desenvolvimento das suas pessoas, a Generali Tranquilidade é o lugar certo para ti.


Vem fazer parte da 2.ª maior seguradora do mercado nacional e usufruí das vantagens e do ambiente desafiante de integrar um grupo internacional e líder mundial no setor.


Responsabilidades

  • Utilizar dados e algoritmos para gerar valor para o negócio, colaborando de forma iterativa com os Product Owners e os Data Engineers;
  • Participar e apoiar a área de tradução de negócio nas diferentes fases de um projeto de machine learning, como o desenho da solução, desenvolvimento e implementação em produção;
  • Apoiar os Data Engineers na validação da infraestrutura de dados e dos modelos para implementação;
  • Ser uma referência no desenvolvimento e inovação do Marketing Algorítmico na empresa, identificando oportunidades de melhoria nos processos atuais e assegurando a sua manutenção em produção;
  • Ter um papel relevante nas iniciativas de GenAI, investigando as melhores práticas atuais, desenvolvendo provas de conceito (POCs) que promovam a eficiência e a qualidade do serviço ao cliente, e definindo standards para os casos de uso internos.



Qualificações

  • Mestrado em Ciência de Dados, Estatística, Matemática, Informática ou equivalente;
  • Entre 2 a 4 anos de experiência em funções semelhantes;
  • Experiência no setor segurador (preferencial);
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de estatística (por exemplo: distribuições, testes de hipóteses, intervalos de confiança, amostragem, etc.);
  • Experiência com AWS (SageMaker, Lambda, etc.) (preferencial);
  • Experiência na utilização de SQL para extração e análise de dados;
  • Domínio no desenvolvimento de código escalável para produção em SQL/Python (preferencial);
  • Bons conhecimentos de ferramentas CI/CD e MLOps, como GitLab/GitHub, MLFlow, Docker, etc.;
  • Fluência em inglês;
  • Experiência em trabalho com equipas ágeis;
  • Boas competências de planeamento e organização do dia a dia;
  • Capacidade de diagnóstico e resolução de problemas;
  • Orientação para resultados e pensamento crítico;
  • Boas competências de comunicação e relacionamento interpessoal.


Candidatura

Os candidatos interessados a esta posição devem enviar o seu CV por email até ao dia 5 de setembro de 2025 para candidaturas@tranquilidade.pt.


O assunto do email deve ser: "Data Scientist"

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Scaleout




Scaleout’s mission is to enable its customers to develop machine learning solutions without compromising on data ownership and privacy. Our main product is the Scaleout Edge platform – designed to orchestrate machine learning across edge-to-cloud. Being built natively for federated learning, our software helps developers tackle challenges like privacy, security, compliance, and data accessibility that inhibit AI adoption in mission-critical organizations. By bringing AI to the data, we enable our customers to train,deploy and govern AI models as close to the edge and data source as possible, be it on vehicles, drones, edge clouds, or industry robots. 




We are serving customers in mission-critical organizations, including defence, automotive and industrial IoT. As a member of the Scaleout team your research will have an impact by pushing the frontier of ML privacy, cybersecurity and embodied AI forward. Scaleout is supported by leading deep tech investors such as Navigare Ventures owned by Wallenberg Investments AB, Fairpoint Capital,  ALMI Invest, Uppsala University Invest and the Beijer Foundation.




Our Workplace




Our team at Scaleout, made up of experts in data science, distributed systems and software engineering combines research expertise from top-ranked Uppsala University with business experience from companies such as Google, BCG and Viacom. You will be part of a team that combines the best from research with a clear focus on industrial impact. In our fast-paced, collaborative environment, we emphasize the value of continuous learning, knowledge-sharing and diverse perspectives. As we focus on helping companies in effectively adopting AI, every team member plays a crucial role in contributing ideas and influencing the company's direction. We provide an innovative environment where you can work on pioneering AI projects, particularly focusing on federated learning and adversarial machine learning, to drive significant advancements in the field. All this, while maintaining a strong commitment to data privacy and ethical AI practices.  




We offer a hybrid workplace. The successful candidate will have a home base in one of our office locations in Uppsala, Stockholm or Göteborg, and will be expected to be available for limited travel to customer facilities and to international conferences. 




Who You Are




We seek passionate individuals who are eager to tackle complex problems. You hold an advanced degree in machine learning, computer science, scientific computing or a related field. Experience in federated learning, software engineering and distributed computing are meriting. 




As a person, you thrive in a collaborative environment and feel excited about the opportunity to actively shape the next wave in machine learning, as well as driving the business forward by participating as an expert resource in technical pre-sales.




The successful candidate must be eligible to obtain and maintain a security clearance.




About the Role




As a member of our machine learning engineering team, your primary focus will be on customer engineering. You will be working closely with our customers to accelerate development of AI use-cases on top of the Scaleout Edge platform. We believe you are passionate about bringing complex new technology to production. You will be expected to take a great deal of ownership and individual responsibility for driving the work forward and for ensuring that the results are delivering outcomes both for our customers and our business. 




You will also contribute to product development and our internal R&D, primarily to our toolkits and workflows realizing machine learning use-cases on top of the Scaleout Edge platform. We believe that you are a high-agency team player, prepared to get the job done also when it requires you to go outside of your technical comfort zone.  




The role will require limited travel to customer premises and to international conferences.  




Job requirements




This role has the following set of required and optional qualifications.




Must have Qualifications 

Advance degree in machine learning, computer science or a related field. 
Proficiency in programming in Python. 
A proven track record of using state-of-the art machine learning techniques to develop AI solutions.
Theoretical understanding of statistical machine learning.  
Strong communication skills. 
Thrive in a high-paced startup environment. 




Meriting Qualifications

3-5 years of industrial experience as an ML engineer.  
Experience in defence, automotive or industrial IoT. 
Experience from consultancy roles. 
Development projects involving drones, robotics, autonomous systems.  
C++, Kotlin, Android development. 
DevOps including hands-on experience with cloud computing and Kubernetes. 
Software Engineering experience.  




The successful candidate must be eligible to obtain and maintain a security clearance.




How to Apply




Please send your CV a cover letter to to andreas@scaleoutsystems.com. Your cover letter should highlight your experiences and skills relevant to the job requirements, as well as your motivation for applying.




We look forward to learning more about you and exploring the potential fit with our team.

  • Thrive in a high-paced startup environment.

  • Experience in defence, automotive or industrial IoT. 
  • Experience from consultancy roles. 
  • Development projects involving drones, robotics, autonomous systems.  
  • C++, Kotlin, Android development. 
  • DevOps including hands-on experience with cloud computing and Kubernetes. 
  • Software Engineering experience.  


The successful candidate must be eligible to obtain and maintain a security clearance.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

At Planner 5D we are searching for a Senior Python Engineer who will join our team and will be building production-ready systems that directly support our product.

Responsibilities:


Design, build, and maintain scalable services that support the AI lifecycle, working closely with the research team to translate cutting-edge ideas into production-ready solutions
Develop tools for pre/post-processing data for AI and other usage
Develop tools for collecting and processing data
Design scalable pipelines for data collection, processing, and transformation powering next-generation AI systems
Bring new models and features to production at scale with Triton Inference Server, ONNX, and TensorRT
Work across the spectrum from rapid MVPs and experimental prototypes to robust, long-term production-grade solutions
Work closely with ChatGPT API, LangChain



Required knowledge of:


Proficient in Python as the primary language with strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to design, deploy, and manage scalable backend platforms in production
Understanding Docker and Kubernetes concepts
Practical experience managing challenges throughout the AI/ML lifecycle, from deployment and orchestration to model management
Ability to translate complex business domains into software models using Domain-Driven Design, supported by SOLID and clean coding practices
Ability to adapt quickly, learn new tools, and work independently on complex problems
Computer Science or Math degree
English Intermediate+



Would be a plus:


Experience with algorithms, data structures and graphs
Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Kotlin, Java)
Deep experience in mathematics (especially linear algebra), geometry, computer vision
Understanding of 2D / 3D technologies and software (for example OpenGL, WebGL, Raytracing, Blender)



What we offer:


Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
Company computer equipment by request
Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
English classes on our corporate platform
Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions



Note: We only consider applications from candidates currently based in locations: Lithuania or Netherlands. Visa sponsorship is available if you hold primary residence with work authorization.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About The Company

"DoubleVerify Scibids" is a global leader in AI-powered digital campaign activation. Scibids empowers global brands to drive specific KPIs and tangible outcomes more effectively while improving operational efficiency and reducing manual lift. DoubleVerify technology does not rely on digital identifiers such as cookies and can be activated across leading Demand-Side Platforms such as The Trade Desk, DV360, and Xandr to mention a few. To learn more visit https://doubleverify.com/scibids-ai/

Recently, DoubleVerify closed its acquisition of Scibids providing an End-to-end, comprehensive measurement and granular optimization. DoubleVerify is the recognized market innovator with the technology and tools that accurately authenticate the quality of digital media and drive ad performance for the world's largest brands. DV provides media transparency and accountability to deliver the highest level of impression quality for maximum advertising performance. Since 2008, DV has helped hundreds of Fortune 500 companies gain the most from their media spend by delivering best-in-class solutions across the digital ecosystem that help build a better industry. Learn more at doubleverify.com

"Scibids DoubleVerify" Technology equips these trading desks with an artificial intelligence software computing the optimal amount to bid for each advertising opportunity, thus bringing the final advertisers dramatic performance and productivity uplifts. The technology developed by Scibids is rooted in a solid scientific and market expertise, with one of the founders holding a PhD. in Machine Learning from ENS Cachan and 10 engineers cumulating 40 years of experience in quantitative advertising.

Our company was selected in 2017 as one of the 62 most innovative startups (amongst 2000+) in the extremely selective “I-Lab” competition by the French public bank & French research ministry. It was also selected in the "Top 100 French Startup To Follow in 2017" by Business Insider.

Two years only after its creation, the company already has several dozens of clients throughout the world and its portfolio keeps on growing! In September 2018, Scibids announced a €2,2M funding in order to support its global ambition to remain the largest algorithmic media trading platform in the world.

What you will do & what we offer

The mission of Scibids DV is to provide media buyers with fully automated buying strategies for display campaigns, leading to uncompared performances for a minimum of human work.

As a DataScientist, your role will be to evaluate and improve "Scibids DoubleVerify" bidding algorithms, which are Scibids main asset, and to actively participate into Scibids automation and development process: each business case not yet automatically handled by our product should be met by the corresponding product improvement. This position will combine analytical rigor, a relentless curiosity, a strong knowledge of statistical methods and experience in implementing them.

This position will combine high development standards, a relentless curiosity, a strong understanding of business priorities and the ambition for your work to become a real game changer!

On a day to day basis, your responsibilities will include:


working with massive datasets (billions of ads impressions/month) and millions of variables.
solving non-routine analysis problems (not handled by off-the-shelf ML solvers).


solving challenging scaling/engineering problems as our system produces thousands of ML models per day.


working closely with the commercial and customer success team and help identify the business cases where a new algorithm is needed/existing ones need improvement.
identify and automate any repetitive process taking place at Scibids, including cases where this means developing some AI routines replacing “human common sense”.


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


MS degree in applied mathematics (e.g., statistics, probabilities, operations research, machine learning).
2 years experience as a Data scientist with actual algorithms implementation in an industry programming language (eg Python, C++...)


Preferred Qualifications


Professional/academic experience in a SQL-like language.


Technical stack relevant to the position


Python
SQL
Kubernetes, Docker, Github
Google Cloud Environment, App Engine Standard, Cloud SQL, Google Cloud Datastore...


Cultural fit


Do things only once. No repetitive task survives ingenuity and automation: at Scibids, everything needs to scale!
Base your decisions on data points. Preconceived personal convictions rarely survive thorough confrontation with actual data.
Work in a team and be curious. Every Scibids member has stock-options and is focused on the same objective: make Scibids the next adtech unicorn! This means being interested in how one’s daily personal work fits in Scibids general strategy and having in mind the greater good of the company rather than individual accomplishments.
Have a good laugh. We are a young, hard-working team with huge ambitions: nothing wipes off long hours of work better than sharing a drink with the team!


Others


Contract type: full-time position (French “CDI”).
Based in Paris (75008) – Champs-Elysées
Preferred availability: ASAP
Compensation: competitive package including fix salary.
Exact figures depend on profile.


#Hybrid
Show more
HTML:
About The Company

"DoubleVerify Scibids" is a global leader in AI-powered digital campaign activation. Scibids empowers global brands to drive specific KPIs and tangible outcomes more effectively while improving operational efficiency and reducing manual lift. DoubleVerify technology does not rely on digital identifiers such as cookies and can be activated across leading Demand-Side Platforms such as The Trade Desk, DV360, and Xandr to mention a few. To learn more visit https://doubleverify.com/scibids-ai/

Recently, DoubleVerify closed its acquisition of Scibids providing an End-to-end, comprehensive measurement and granular optimization. DoubleVerify is the recognized market innovator with the technology and tools that accurately authenticate the quality of digital media and drive ad performance for the world's largest brands. DV provides media transparency and accountability to deliver the highest level of impression quality for maximum advertising performance. Since 2008, DV has helped hundreds of Fortune 500 companies gain the most from their media spend by delivering best-in-class solutions across the digital ecosystem that help build a better industry. Learn more at doubleverify.com

"Scibids DoubleVerify" Technology equips these trading desks with an artificial intelligence software computing the optimal amount to bid for each advertising opportunity, thus bringing the final advertisers dramatic performance and productivity uplifts. The technology developed by Scibids is rooted in a solid scientific and market expertise, with one of the founders holding a PhD. in Machine Learning from ENS Cachan and 10 engineers cumulating 40 years of experience in quantitative advertising.

Our company was selected in 2017 as one of the 62 most innovative startups (amongst 2000+) in the extremely selective “I-Lab” competition by the French public bank & French research ministry. It was also selected in the "Top 100 French Startup To Follow in 2017" by Business Insider.

Two years only after its creation, the company already has several dozens of clients throughout the world and its portfolio keeps on growing! In September 2018, Scibids announced a €2,2M funding in order to support its global ambition to remain the largest algorithmic media trading platform in the world.

What you will do & what we offer

The mission of Scibids DV is to provide media buyers with fully automated buying strategies for display campaigns, leading to uncompared performances for a minimum of human work.

As a DataScientist, your role will be to evaluate and improve "Scibids DoubleVerify" bidding algorithms, which are Scibids main asset, and to actively participate into Scibids automation and development process: each business case not yet automatically handled by our product should be met by the corresponding product improvement. This position will combine analytical rigor, a relentless curiosity, a strong knowledge of statistical methods and experience in implementing them.

This position will combine high development standards, a relentless curiosity, a strong understanding of business priorities and the ambition for your work to become a real game changer!

On a day to day basis, your responsibilities will include:

  • working with massive datasets (billions of ads impressions/month) and millions of variables.
  • solving non-routine analysis problems (not handled by off-the-shelf ML solvers).

solving challenging scaling/engineering problems as our system produces thousands of ML models per day.

  • working closely with the commercial and customer success team and help identify the business cases where a new algorithm is needed/existing ones need improvement.
  • identify and automate any repetitive process taking place at Scibids, including cases where this means developing some AI routines replacing “human common sense”.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • MS degree in applied mathematics (e.g., statistics, probabilities, operations research, machine learning).
  • 2 years experience as a Data scientist with actual algorithms implementation in an industry programming language (eg Python, C++...)

Preferred Qualifications

  • Professional/academic experience in a SQL-like language.

Technical stack relevant to the position

  • Python
  • SQL
  • Kubernetes, Docker, Github
  • Google Cloud Environment, App Engine Standard, Cloud SQL, Google Cloud Datastore...

Cultural fit

  • Do things only once. No repetitive task survives ingenuity and automation: at Scibids, everything needs to scale!
  • Base your decisions on data points. Preconceived personal convictions rarely survive thorough confrontation with actual data.
  • Work in a team and be curious. Every Scibids member has stock-options and is focused on the same objective: make Scibids the next adtech unicorn! This means being interested in how one’s daily personal work fits in Scibids general strategy and having in mind the greater good of the company rather than individual accomplishments.
  • Have a good laugh. We are a young, hard-working team with huge ambitions: nothing wipes off long hours of work better than sharing a drink with the team!

Others

  • Contract type: full-time position (French “CDI”).
  • Based in Paris (75008) – Champs-Elysées
  • Preferred availability: ASAP
  • Compensation: competitive package including fix salary.
  • Exact figures depend on profile.

AwBrainprocura um(a)Senior Data Scientistcom forte experiência em projetos de IA, machine learning e MLOps, para apoiar a implementação de iniciativas estratégicas na área deInteligência Artificial.

O projeto decorre num ambiente altamente regulado, com forte ligação às áreas deResponsible AI, Data Governance e reporting executivo.

  • Principais Responsabilidades:

Apoiar iniciativas de IA, incluindoreporting, planos de ação e preparação de materiais executivos(QBRs, steering committees, etc.);

Analisar e acompanhar osrequisitos funcionais e técnicos, colaborando com equipas regulatórias e de IT;

Apoiar o desenho e implementação depráticas de qualidade e guidelines de Responsible AI;

Desenvolver e otimizar modelos de machine learning e deep learning com foco em dados estruturados e não estruturados ('at rest');

Garantir aqualidade, rastreabilidade e explicabilidadedos modelos ao longo do seu ciclo de vida.

  • Requisitos:

Até15 anos de experiênciana função de Data Scientist ou semelhante;

Licenciatura emEngenharia Informática, de Software ou similar;

Fluente emportuguês, inglês e espanhol(oral e escrito);

Excelente capacidade decomunicação, análise crítica e resolução de problemas;

Experiência combases de dados relacionais e NoSQL;

Experiência emPython, R ou SAS, com deployment para produção e gestão do ciclo de vida dos modelos;

Domínio de frameworks comoTensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch;

Conhecimento depipelines de dados e MLOps;

Experiência comAzure, AWS ou GCP,Kubernetes e Docker;

Familiaridade comJIRA, Confluence e metodologias Agile.

  • Altamente valorizado:

Participação em projetos deResponsible AI, Data Governance e regulação tecnológica;

Capacidade de atuar em contextos estratégicos e prepararmateriais executivos e relatórios de alto nível;

Experiência em dinamização desessões, fóruns e comunidades técnicas;

Capacidade de trabalho comequipas multidisciplinares(negócio, tech leads, stakeholders, reguladores).

  • Candidaturas:

Envia o teu CV ****** o assunto:

Senior Data Scientist – Outubro 2025

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are working with a pioneering deeptech organisation dedicated to transforming the drug discovery and development process in immunology and inflammation. With a unique foundation model dedicated to immune-mediated diseases, the company leverages multimodal data to bridge the gap in translational research, accelerate the validation of new therapeutic targets, and advance the development of personalised treatments.

Backed by significant recent funding and recognised as one of the most promising startups in Europe, this is an opportunity to join a highly collaborative, science-led team at the forefront of AI in healthcare.




This role will offer you:

The opportunity to design and optimise transformer-based foundation models for biomedical data, including transcriptomics, histology, and large-scale clinical datasets.
A key role in building scalable ML infrastructure and pipelines to support research and production applications.
Collaboration with a multidisciplinary team of AI researchers, computational biologists, and immunologists.
A chance to contribute to cutting-edge science featured in top-tier journals and international congresses.




Responsibilities:

Develop, implement, and fine-tune ML models, with a focus on pre-training, fine-tuning, and benchmarking at scale.
Build and maintain scalable ML pipelines, including data preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and deployment.
Apply MLOps best practices, ensuring model versioning, monitoring, and reproducibility.
Transform raw biomedical datasets into deep-learning-ready loaders capable of scaling to millions of datapoints.
Collaborate closely with scientific experts to align AI approaches with biological questions and translational applications.




You will bring:

Master’s degree or PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years’ experience with deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX).
Strong Python skills and experience in production ML systems, including containerisation (Docker), orchestration (Kubernetes), and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Hands-on experience with MLOps frameworks (Kubeflow, MLflow, Weights & Biases, Metaflow) and modern DevOps practices.
Experience with distributed training, GPU programming, and model optimisation techniques.




How to stand out:

Experience with biological or healthcare data, especially transcriptomics or histology.
Background in foundation models (NLP or multimodal).
Strong adaptability and motivation to work in a dynamic, fast-growing startup environment.
A team-oriented mindset with high agency and problem-solving skills.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At RebelsAI, we turn the potential of Generative AI into real-world impact. We help companies become truly AI-driven by building smart, scalable solutions that actually work. From the first idea to implementation, we make AI practical and valuable.




As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work closely with our founding team. You will design and build the systems that power our AI products and prototypes. You will have real influence and the freedom to explore and grow as part of a young and ambitious startup.




What you will do

You will work hands-on with data, models and cloud tools to build the technical core of our AI solutions. Your work helps clients automate, improve and innovate.




You will:

Build and deploy machine learning models using platforms like Google Cloud, Azure and AWS
Design ML pipelines with tools such as Vertex AI, BigQuery, Dataflow and Dataproc
Choose the right infrastructure for each job, whether that is VMs, containers, GPUs or TPUs
Apply strong data security and privacy practices in every project
Work closely with consultants and clients to solve real problems with real value
Experiment with GenAI tools and turn ideas into working prototypes
Help shape solutions from first version to production-ready




What you bring

You have a strong technical foundation and a curious mindset. You are eager to build real things and see them used in the world.
A degree in AI, Data Science, Computer Science or a related field
Solid Python skills and experience with libraries like NumPy, Pandas and scikit-learn
A good understanding of machine learning principles and data analysis
Familiarity with cloud environments such as Azure, GCP or AWS
Fluent in Dutch and English




Experience with tools like LangChain, vector databases or GenAI architectures is a plus but not required. You will have the space to learn and grow.




The kind of Rebel we are looking for

We are looking for someone who is hands-on, self-starting and not afraid to ask questions. You enjoy variety, take initiative and want to be part of a team that builds and learns together.




You are:

Eager to learn and try new things
Confident working independently and with others
Practical and focused on delivering results
Passionate about the possibilities of AI and how it can help people and organizations

What we offer

A growing startup where your voice matters
A small and driven team that supports and challenges each other
Competitive salary
Laptop and travel expense reimbursement
Flexibility to work 4 or 5 days a week
Hybrid working setup with a base in Rotterdam




About RebelsAI

We help organizations get the most out of Generative AI. From workshops and readiness scans to tailored applications and long-term strategy, we guide our clients every step of the way. We focus on what is useful, realistic and impactful. AI should help people thrive.

Ready to build what is next




If this sounds like the right challenge for you, we would love to meet. Send us your resume and a short note about why you are excited to join RebelsAI. Visit us at rebelsai.nl or find us on LinkedIn. We welcome all backgrounds and perspectives. We believe diverse teams build better solutions.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST / AI EXPERT (F/M/D)
Description:
Do You want to be part of „Ignitis Group“?

We invite an experienced Data Scientist / AI Expert (Smart Energy Solutions) to join our team. You will be responsible for the development, implementation, support, and maintenance of the IT ecosystem for providing new services to Latvian energy consumers. This is an exciting opportunity to build and shape future energy solutions from the ground up using the latest technologies. If that speaks to you, we’d be happy to welcome you to our team!

Take YOUR part in #EnergySmart!

You will contribute to green and secure energy ecosystem creation by:



Proposing and implementing artificial intelligence ideas that will transform tomorrow's digital customer and employee experiences
Developing and implementing data-driven models and analyses to support decision-making in business processes
Identifying and developing new AI-enabled services for customers (e.g., personalized tariff plans, optimal consumption recommendations, accurate consumption forecasting, customer support tools)
Working with large datasets, including both structured and unstructured data
Monitoring market trends, analyzing artificial intelligence application opportunities, and implementing pilot projects for proposed ideas
Ensuring the deployment and maintenance of models and solutions in a production environment (service deployment and maintenance, model training and evaluation)
Collaborating closely with IT development, product, and business teams to ensure solutions meet business objectives



Required for this position:



At least one year of experience in developing and applying artificial intelligence solutions in business environments
Strong programming skills (e.g., Python) for model development, data analysis, machine learning, and working with GenAI libraries
An understanding of the value created by rapid prototyping, MVPs, or pilot projects, with direct involvement in their implementation
Proficiency in Latvian and English (oral and written) as this role involves regular communication with international colleagues and partners



Would be an advantage:



Experience or interest in working with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Understanding of MLOps (Machine Learning Operations) principles and tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines)



In return for creating a more sustainable future, we promise:



Take part in an unfolding energy transformation process to create a 100% green and secure energy ecosystem for both current and future generations
Compensation corresponding to experience and competencies, and financial incentives dependent on achieved results
A hybrid work model (3+2) and flexible working hours
Additional paid days for health improvement, short-term illness, volunteering, and accumulated work experience
Internal career opportunities
Extensive learning and qualification enhancement programs
Diverse and inclusive environment



Salary range for this position group: is 3405 to 5108 EUR (before taxes). The final offer depends on experience and competence. Variable part of remuneration may be paid depending on results.

About us

Do you want to contribute to projects changing the meaning of energy consumption in the Baltics and beyond? Ignitis is a part of the Ignitis Group – a renewables-focused integrated utility. Our purpose is to create a 100% green and secure energy ecosystem for current and future generations.

Ignitis offers advanced energy solutions and services to both private and business clients, enabling effective energy management, consumption, and production. The electric vehicle quick-charge network, Ignitis ON, significantly contributes to sustainable mobility in the Baltics. We supply power and natural gas to 1.5 million customers in Lithuania and, through our operations in Latvia, Estonia, Finland, and Poland, we are accelerating the development of green energy throughout the wider Baltic region.

www.ignitis.lv #ignitisgroup

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Uphold

Uphold is a financial technology company that believes on-chain services are the future of finance. It provides modern infrastructure for on-chain payments, banking and investments. Offering Consumer Services, Business Services and Institutional Trading, Uphold makes pioneering financial services easy and trusted for millions of customers in more than 140 countries.

Uphold strips away the complexity and lack of transparency to open up Web3 finance for everyone.

To learn more about Uphold, please visit https://uphold.com.

The Opportunity

Uphold is looking for a Data Scientist to join our Data team. This is an incredibly exciting opportunity where you’ll get to join a team of engineers, scientists, and analysts who are passionate about data and technology with a great sense of collaboration and responsibility.

You’ll be responsible for data-driven insights that enable our company to optimize business processes, empower financial decisions, and drive the product roadmap. You will gather, organize, and aggregate large sets of data in order to produce meaningful business insight and solve critical challenges that give us a competitive edge. You will also be tasked with planning and developing the foundations for data-enabled product initiatives.

What You'll Be Doing Primarily


Conduct in-depth data explorations and analysis used by leadership, as well as by the marketing, business development, and financial teams to enhance targeting, increase revenue, and allocate resources more efficiently.
Evaluate specific product and sales performance to make recommendations to Senior Management to increase productivity and drive efficiency.
Collect, clean, and explore large datasets for analysis.
Bring machine learning systems to life as product features and decision-support systems.
Design and conduct controlled experiments to evaluate and continuously improve key aspects such as product features and marketing communications.
Research, design, and evaluate state-of-the-art data-mining practices that could provide Uphold with a competitive edge.
Contribute to the definition of overarching processes and practices across the Data Team and the rest of the company.
Evangelize a data-driven culture throughout Uphold multiple business units.
Communicate results clearly, concisely, and assertively, either orally or via well-documented dashboards, visualizations, and reports.



Required Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, economics, statistics, informatics, data science, or engineering.
Strong knowledge of probability, descriptive, and inferential statistics.
Demonstrated knowledge of applying data mining and machine learning techniques to real-world data (e.g. classification, clustering, time series forecasting).
Strong knowledge of Python and SQL.
Experience working with data warehousing solutions and leveraging models in a cloud-based environment.
Proven ability to transform the results of complex modeling procedures into concrete decisions and actions.
Ability to lead small projects from conception and design through implementation to delivery and communication.
Drive to grow as a well-rounded data scientist, namely in quantitative methods, software engineering, communication, and business.
Creativity, curiosity, and a growth mindset.
Team player with the ability to work within cross-functional teams.
Value and results-oriented, with a keen eye for quality of deliverables.
Fluent written and oral English skills.



Bonus If You Have


An advanced degree (preferred).
Experience working with database systems such as PostgreSQL and Snowflake.
Fluency in cryptocurrencies, smart contracts, and other digitized financial instruments.
Community talks, certifications, and/or blog posts on your areas of interest.
Open-source project contributions of any kind, such as tools developed to solve specific problems you’ve had or fixing issues on existing projects.



Importantly, if you’re looking for a senior role with us, you will have achieved many of the things above while also providing mentorship to others, and have engaged in public speaking opportunities.

What We Have To Offer You


An amazing work environment in a company that continues to grow, driven by extraordinary and passionate people who keep up innovating and challenging more each day.
An international team, in a cutting-edge field, working on the most fascinating projects.
Growth and career opportunities, and the chance to be proactive and creative.
A flexible and enthusiastic work environment that offers you snacks, a lot of coffee, and other great benefits.
Open and transparent culture - we get together on a weekly basis to share updates, and strategic plans, and engage with each other informally over food and drinks.
Interesting events that keep you connected with the team and celebrate our success.



Be part of a great company that is revolutionizing financial services. Apply now!

EEOC Employer

We're proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and we celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, gender identity, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, and any other protected classes. Difference makes us better.
Show more

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, economics, statistics, informatics, data science, or engineering.
  • Strong knowledge of probability, descriptive, and inferential statistics.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of applying data mining and machine learning techniques to real-world data (e.g. classification, clustering, time series forecasting).
  • Strong knowledge of Python and SQL.
  • Experience working with data warehousing solutions and leveraging models in a cloud-based environment.
  • Proven ability to transform the results of complex modeling procedures into concrete decisions and actions.
  • Ability to lead small projects from conception and design through implementation to delivery and communication.
  • Drive to grow as a well-rounded data scientist, namely in quantitative methods, software engineering, communication, and business.
  • Creativity, curiosity, and a growth mindset.
  • Team player with the ability to work within cross-functional teams.
  • Value and results-oriented, with a keen eye for quality of deliverables.
  • Fluent written and oral English skills.


Bonus If You Have

  • An advanced degree (preferred).
  • Experience working with database systems such as PostgreSQL and Snowflake.
  • Fluency in cryptocurrencies, smart contracts, and other digitized financial instruments.
  • Community talks, certifications, and/or blog posts on your areas of interest.
  • Open-source project contributions of any kind, such as tools developed to solve specific problems you’ve had or fixing issues on existing projects.


Importantly, if you’re looking for a senior role with us, you will have achieved many of the things above while also providing mentorship to others, and have engaged in public speaking opportunities.

What We Have To Offer You

  • An amazing work environment in a company that continues to grow, driven by extraordinary and passionate people who keep up innovating and challenging more each day.
  • An international team, in a cutting-edge field, working on the most fascinating projects.
  • Growth and career opportunities, and the chance to be proactive and creative.
  • A flexible and enthusiastic work environment that offers you snacks, a lot of coffee, and other great benefits.
  • Open and transparent culture - we get together on a weekly basis to share updates, and strategic plans, and engage with each other informally over food and drinks.
  • Interesting events that keep you connected with the team and celebrate our success.


Be part of a great company that is revolutionizing financial services. Apply now!

EEOC Employer

We're proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and we celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, gender identity, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, and any other protected classes. Difference makes us better.

Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
Founded in 2005 in Lisbon by three visionary entrepreneurs, MoOngy quickly became a leading group in Engineering and Information Technology (IT) across Europe and North Africa. Today, with a presence in 14 countries and more than 40 subsidiary companies, MoOngy employs over 9,500 talents who share a common passion for innovation and excellence.

The International Mobility Recruitment Department is dedicated to enhancing the mobility of IT professionals throughout Europe, facilitating the placement of talents in the various markets where it operates.




Position: AI Data Scientist

📍 Location: Brussels, Belgium

🏢 Full time; Hybrid (2-3 days/week at client office)

📜 Type of Contract: Freelance or Permanent Contract preferably

🌍 Mandatory Languages: English + French or Dutch

📌 Eligibility: Candidates must possess European nationality or a valid work permit for Belgium.







Requirements

5–8 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist, preferably in a business environment.
Strong business acumen with proven ability to translate business needs into data-driven solutions.
Hands-on expertise in data wrangling, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning.
Advanced proficiency in Python and libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn.
Solid experience with SQL, Databricks, and Power BI.
Proven track record in AI/GenAI delivery across POCs, pilots, and industrial processes.
Deep knowledge of cloud platforms, ideally Microsoft Azure (Azure AI Services, Azure ML, Azure OpenAI, Vertex AI).
Strong expertise in LLM libraries: LangChain, LangGraph, Promptflow, Semantic Kernel, Autogen.
In-depth understanding of LLMOps lifecycle including fine-tuning, training, deployment, and monitoring.
Experience in GenAI deployment using CI/CD pipelines, GitHub workflows, and tools like Weights & Biases.
Excellent collaboration, communication, and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to keep a helicopter view on projects.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy advanced AI and GenAI models aligned with business objectives.
Lead AI/GenAI delivery processes from proof of concept to industrialization.
Act as a super user within IT AI environments, providing guidance and expertise.
Work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into actionable data science initiatives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI models into business processes.
Monitor, evaluate, and optimize deployed models to ensure accuracy, performance, and reliability.
Stay updated with the latest trends in AI, LLMOps, and cloud technologies to continuously enhance solutions.




Advantages of joining MoOngy:

🌍 International Mobility: Access to a dedicated international mobility department with personalized relocation programs to facilitate your move to a new country.

🚀 Career Development: Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies across multiple sectors and European markets.

📚 Continuous Learning: Free ongoing training and career-oriented certifications to boost your expertise.

💡 Personal Growth: Collaborate with professionals from across Europe, exchanging ideas and best practices in IT.

🌐 Global Network: Become part of a leading global tech community, with access to exciting and challenging projects in different European markets.




At MoOngy Group, we stand for equality and diversity. We create a safe and inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, or any factor other than merit.

👉 If you have the skills for this role, we encourage you to apply!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Sei un/a vero/a appassionato di codice e sei pronto a metterti in gioco su progetti internazionali?

Unisciti a XTN Cognitive Security® e partecipa in prima persona allo sviluppo di soluzioni di sicurezza avanzate basate sulle analisi biometriche. Entrando a far parte del nostro team avrai modo di lavorare fianco a fianco con colleghi brillanti e competenti da cui imparare e trarre ispirazione. Affiancare professionisti del settore nel debellare nuove minacce e contribuire in prima persona alle soluzioni che abbiamo ideato per fermarle, sono solo alcune delle esperienze che vivrai entrando a far parte del nostro team.

Sei curioso/a di scoprire come potrebbe essere la tua giornata tipo?

ATTIVITA’ PREVISTE

Sarai dedicato all'analisi dei dati
dovrai avere famigliarità con la programmazione (es. java)
Dovrai avere una predisposizione nell'interazione coi clienti
Utilizzerai pacchetto office (in particolare excel e powerpoint)
Suggerirai strategie ed approcci per utilizzare al meglio le informazioni delle quali possiamo disporre per contrastare il crimine informatico;
Userai linguaggi quali R, SQL, Pyton, Golang, C e Java




COSA OFFRIAMO

Sviluppo prodotti: XTN è un’azienda di prodotto con sedi in Italia e USA. Facendo parte del team avrai la possibilità di sviluppare prodotti di Behavioural-based Threat e Fraud Protection leader nel settore. Potrai conoscere meglio lo stato dell’arte in materia di prevenzione delle frodi informatiche e soprattutto scoprire e approfondire nuove e rilevanti tecnologie.
Location 1: lavorerai nel polo direzionale più moderno e innovativo di Padova. Gli uffici XTN, infatti, si trovano al 10° piano della Net Tower, cuore pulsante del NetCenter. Un ambiente di lavoro confortevole, dotato di cucina e area relax.
Location 2: lavorerai nel polo direzionale Caldera Park di Milano. Gli uffici XTN, infatti, si trovano nel centro Regus in Via Caldera. Un ambiente di lavoro confortevole, dotato di cucina, area relax e molti altri servizi nella struttura.
Location 3: lavorerai nel polo ImpactHub di Trento. Un ambiente di lavoro confortevole, proprio dietro il Museo delle Scienze (MUSE).
Contratto: offriamo un contratto di assunzione in linea con il profilo richiesto.




BENEFIT

Orario di lavoro Flessibile
Disponibilità di Smart Working
Ticket Restaurant
Assicurazione Integrativa

COSA CERCHIAMO

Titolo di studio: laurea in matematica o informatica con specializzazione nell’ambito dei modelli di dati (data science)
Passione per l’ambito: hai una forte passione per il mondo dello sviluppo e della cybersecurity e non vedi l’ora di trasformarla in lavoro.
Esperienza con i modelli di dati: hai messo in pratica in qualche contesto reale le tecniche per poter ricavare le informazioni dai dati attraverso il Machine Learning
Iniziativa e curiosità: sei curioso/a, creativo/a e sempre in cerca di nuove opportunità per mettere in pratica le tue idee. Hai sete di conoscenza e una forte necessità di metterti alla prova.
Umiltà: sei pronto/a ad accogliere feedback e critiche costruttive che ti permetteranno di ottenere i migliori risultati con grande soddisfazione.
Lavoro in team: sei capace di lavorare in team con un approccio collaborativo per trovare soluzioni condividendo le idee
Inglese: scrivi e leggi bene in inglese e riesci a condurre una conversazione fluente anche su temi tecnici.

Show more
