Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Are you ready to trade your job for a journey? Become a FlyMate!

Passion, excitement & global collaboration are all core to what it means to be a FlyMate. At Flywire, we’re on a mission to deliver the world’s most important and complex payments. We use our Flywire Advantage - the combination of our next-gen payments platform, proprietary payment network and vertical specific software, to help our clients get paid, and help their customers pay with ease - no matter where they are in the world.

What more do we need to truly be unstoppable? Perhaps, that is you!

Who We Are

Flywire is a global payments enablement and software company, founded a decade ago to solve high-stakes, high-value payments in education, using modern technology.

Today, we’ve digitized payments for more than 3,300+ global clients across education, healthcare, travel & B2B, covering more than 240 countries and territories and supporting over 140 currencies. And, we’re just getting started!

With over 1000+ global FlyMates, representing more than 40 nationalities, and in 14 offices world-wide, we’re looking for FlyMates to join the next stage of our journey as we continue to grow.

Job Description

The Opportunity:

Flywire is seeking a versatile AI Engineer with strong backend development skills to scale our AI-driven solutions and infrastructure. As an AI Engineer, you’ll join a small, but high-impact team where creativity, resourcefulness, and a willingness to wear many hats are essential. In this role, you'll bridge the gap between backend systems and advanced AI models, ensuring models are robustly deployed, integrated, and monitored throughout our products. You’ll collaborate closely with data scientists, software engineers, and DevOps to bring AI initiatives from prototype to production in a secure, scalable, and reliable way.

This role blends backend engineering with AI/ML expertise and is ideal for someone passionate about building world-class AI-powered products at scale.

Here's What We're Looking For


AI Solution Engineering: Design, implement, and optimize robust systems for deploying and serving AI/ML models (including LLMs and generative AI) across Flywire’s services.
Backend & API Development: Build and maintain APIs (RESTful, real-time, and/or event-based) and backend services and infrastructure for integrating AI/ML into our products.
Model Deployment & Lifecycle Management: Collaborate with data scientists to deploy, monitor, and manage models in production, including versioning, testing, scaling, and retraining.
Cloud & Infrastructure/MLOps: Manage cloud environments (primarily AWS), databases, and develop CI/CD pipelines for robust, scalable AI applications, including monitoring and automation.
System Monitoring & Optimization: Implement monitoring, logging, and health tracking for models and supporting infrastructure to ensure availability, reliability, and performance.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work with engineers, product managers, and data teams to scope, build, and refine features powered by AI, ensuring alignment with business needs.
Adaptability & Proactiveness: Thrive in a small team environment by pitching in wherever needed, whether that means wrangling data, optimizing an API, debugging infrastructure, or brainstorming with stakeholders.


Qualifications

Minimum Qualification Criteria:


Backend Development Expertise: Strong experience in backend development of microservices. Proficiency in Python is strongly preferred.
Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with cloud platforms like AWS, particularly with services like RDS and Redis. Experience with Amazon Bedrock is a plus.
CI/CD Pipelines: Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for both backend services and AI/ML models.
ML Ops Knowledge: Experience in deploying and managing AI/ML models in production, ensuring their scalability and performance.


Preferred Criteria


AI Experience and Interest: Experience with generative AI, large language models (LLMs), or advanced NLP systems, and a strong desire to learn and stay at the forefront of AI innovation.
Experience with Full-Stack Development: Exposure to front-end development or full-stack experience is a plus, especially involving integration of AI models into customer-facing products
Experience in Finance or Payments: Background in international finance, the payments space, or other highly regulated environments is an advantage, particularly in scaling backend systems.


Additional Information

What We Offer:


Competitive compensation, including Restricted Stock Units
Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
Flying Start - Our immersive Global Induction Program (Meet our Execs & Global Teams)
Work with brilliant people that will keep you on your toes, learn more about their journeys by checking out #InsideFlywire on social media
Dynamic & Global Team (we have been collaborating virtually for years!)
Wellbeing Programs (Mental Health, Wellness, Yoga/Pilates/HIIT Classes) with Global FlyMates
Be a meaningful part in our success - every FlyMate makes an impact
Competitive time off including FlyBetter Days to volunteer in a cause you believe in and
Digital Disconnect Days!
Great Talent & Development Programs (Managers Taking Flight – for new or aspiring managers!)


Submit today and get started!

We are excited to get to know you! Throughout our process you can expect to meet with different FlyMates including the Hiring Manager, Peers on the team, the VP of the department, and a skills assessment. Your Talent Acquisition Partner will walk you through the steps and be your “go-to” person for any questions.

Flywire is an equal opportunity employer. With over 30 nationalities across 12 different offices, and diversity and inclusion at the core of our people agenda, we believe our FlyMates are our greatest asset, and we’re excited to watch our unique culture evolve with each new hire.

Flywire is an equal opportunity employer.


Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Are you ready to trade your job for a journey? Become a FlyMate!

Passion, excitement & global collaboration are all core to what it means to be a FlyMate. At Flywire, we’re on a mission to deliver the world’s most important and complex payments. We use our Flywire Advantage - the combination of our next-gen payments platform, proprietary payment network and vertical specific software, to help our clients get paid, and help their customers pay with ease - no matter where they are in the world.

What more do we need to truly be unstoppable? Perhaps, that is you!

Who We Are

Flywire is a global payments enablement and software company, founded a decade ago to solve high-stakes, high-value payments in education, using modern technology.

Today, we’ve digitized payments for more than 3,300+ global clients across education, healthcare, travel & B2B, covering more than 240 countries and territories and supporting over 140 currencies. And, we’re just getting started!

With over 1000+ global FlyMates, representing more than 40 nationalities, and in 14 offices world-wide, we’re looking for FlyMates to join the next stage of our journey as we continue to grow.

Job Description

The Opportunity:

Flywire is seeking a versatile AI Engineer with strong backend development skills to scale our AI-driven solutions and infrastructure. As an AI Engineer, you’ll join a small, but high-impact team where creativity, resourcefulness, and a willingness to wear many hats are essential. In this role, you'll bridge the gap between backend systems and advanced AI models, ensuring models are robustly deployed, integrated, and monitored throughout our products. You’ll collaborate closely with data scientists, software engineers, and DevOps to bring AI initiatives from prototype to production in a secure, scalable, and reliable way.

This role blends backend engineering with AI/ML expertise and is ideal for someone passionate about building world-class AI-powered products at scale.

Here's What We're Looking For

  • AI Solution Engineering: Design, implement, and optimize robust systems for deploying and serving AI/ML models (including LLMs and generative AI) across Flywire’s services.
  • Backend & API Development: Build and maintain APIs (RESTful, real-time, and/or event-based) and backend services and infrastructure for integrating AI/ML into our products.
  • Model Deployment & Lifecycle Management: Collaborate with data scientists to deploy, monitor, and manage models in production, including versioning, testing, scaling, and retraining.
  • Cloud & Infrastructure/MLOps: Manage cloud environments (primarily AWS), databases, and develop CI/CD pipelines for robust, scalable AI applications, including monitoring and automation.
  • System Monitoring & Optimization: Implement monitoring, logging, and health tracking for models and supporting infrastructure to ensure availability, reliability, and performance.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Work with engineers, product managers, and data teams to scope, build, and refine features powered by AI, ensuring alignment with business needs.
  • Adaptability & Proactiveness: Thrive in a small team environment by pitching in wherever needed, whether that means wrangling data, optimizing an API, debugging infrastructure, or brainstorming with stakeholders.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualification Criteria:

  • Backend Development Expertise: Strong experience in backend development of microservices. Proficiency in Python is strongly preferred.
  • Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with cloud platforms like AWS, particularly with services like RDS and Redis. Experience with Amazon Bedrock is a plus.
  • CI/CD Pipelines: Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for both backend services and AI/ML models.
  • ML Ops Knowledge: Experience in deploying and managing AI/ML models in production, ensuring their scalability and performance.

Preferred Criteria

  • AI Experience and Interest: Experience with generative AI, large language models (LLMs), or advanced NLP systems, and a strong desire to learn and stay at the forefront of AI innovation.
  • Experience with Full-Stack Development: Exposure to front-end development or full-stack experience is a plus, especially involving integration of AI models into customer-facing products
  • Experience in Finance or Payments: Background in international finance, the payments space, or other highly regulated environments is an advantage, particularly in scaling backend systems.

Additional Information

What We Offer:

  • Competitive compensation, including Restricted Stock Units
  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
  • Flying Start - Our immersive Global Induction Program (Meet our Execs & Global Teams)
  • Work with brilliant people that will keep you on your toes, learn more about their journeys by checking out #InsideFlywire on social media
  • Dynamic & Global Team (we have been collaborating virtually for years!)
  • Wellbeing Programs (Mental Health, Wellness, Yoga/Pilates/HIIT Classes) with Global FlyMates
  • Be a meaningful part in our success - every FlyMate makes an impact
  • Competitive time off including FlyBetter Days to volunteer in a cause you believe in and
  • Digital Disconnect Days!
  • Great Talent & Development Programs (Managers Taking Flight – for new or aspiring managers!)

Submit today and get started!

We are excited to get to know you! Throughout our process you can expect to meet with different FlyMates including the Hiring Manager, Peers on the team, the VP of the department, and a skills assessment. Your Talent Acquisition Partner will walk you through the steps and be your “go-to” person for any questions.

Flywire is an equal opportunity employer. With over 30 nationalities across 12 different offices, and diversity and inclusion at the core of our people agenda, we believe our FlyMates are our greatest asset, and we’re excited to watch our unique culture evolve with each new hire.

Flywire is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a Power Platform and Copilot/Azure AI Developer to design and build intelligent conversational agents and workflow automation solutions for the North Carolina Department of Transportation (NCDOT). The developer will leverage Microsoft Copilot Studio, Power Platform, and Azure AI services to deliver advanced chatbots and process automation that improve productivity across NCDOT’s Teams, SharePoint, Microsoft 365, and external systems.

The ideal candidate is hands-on with chatbot design, workflow automation, and AI/LLM integration. This role is not focused on administration, but requires deployment experience within Power Platform environments and the ability to integrate solutions securely and efficiently.

This position requires candidates to be local to the Raleigh/Durham/Chapel Hill, NC area and available onsite up to 3 days per week.

The Power Platform and Copilot/Azure AI Developer will be responsible for:

Design, develop, and deploy Copilot Studio chatbots with advanced dialog flows and branching logic.

Integrate chat-driven interfaces across Teams, SharePoint, and M365 applications.

Build and maintain Power Automate workflows that connect Microsoft 365, external APIs, and databases.

Develop Power Apps to extend chatbot and workflow capabilities.

Configure custom connectors and third-party integrations.

Implement and optimize solutions using Azure AI services and external LLM platforms (Gemini, Claude, ChatGPT).

Apply governance, security, and compliance policies across Power Platform environments.

Collaborate with stakeholders and technical teams to troubleshoot integration issues and ensure smooth deployments.

Document configurations, integration points, and best practices for knowledge sharing.




Expertise and/or Relevant Experience:




Required Skills - Power Platform and Copilot/Azure AI Developer

M1. 3+ years of hands-on Power Platform development (deployment to environments, solution-based deployment).

M2. 6+ years of experience with Power Automate workflows across M365 and external systems.

M3. 4+ years of Power Apps development.

M4. 3+ years of SharePoint development and integration.

M5. 5+ years of experience working with Microsoft 365 ecosystem.

M6. 1+ years hands-on with Copilot Studio chatbot development.

M7. 1+ years integrating chatbots with external services.

M8. 2+ years of Azure AI service development.

M9. 2+ years working with non-Microsoft LLM platforms (e.g., Gemini, Claude, ChatGPT).

M10. Candidates must currently reside in the Raleigh/Durham/Chapel Hill, NC area.




Highly Desired Skills - Power Platform and Copilot/Azure AI Developer

D1.Microsoft Certifications: PL-900 (Power Platform Fundamentals), AI-900 (Azure AI Fundamentals), AI-102 (AI Engineer), MS-900 (M365 Fundamentals).

D2. Strong understanding of Power Platform governance and security best practices.

D3. Experience deploying in DevOps environments with Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines.

D4. Strong problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.

D5. Ability to work collaboratively in a hybrid government IT setting.

Title: Audi Technologist
Description:
The Audi Technologist is designed to work in coordination with other department employees to provide a truly exceptional customer experience. To be truly exceptional, requires a retailer wide commitment to not only meeting customer expectations; but exceeding them. Technologist assists the sales department with customer technology questions and concerns prior to purchase.

Responsibilities


New car delivery specialist.
New and Used car photography and descriptions.
Prepare and apply all Used Car window stickers and Buyers Guides.
Visually assess inventory and work with General Sales Manager on lot placement.
Assists service, sales, and administrative team with daily requested functions which may require local area travel.
Second delivery which requires up to date explanation of vehicle technologies to customers after delivery. Must be well versed in Acura brand and product knowledge.
Assists clients with home link or Bluetooth phoned pairing - may require local or extensive travel



Benefits


State-of-the-Art facility
CAFE 125 Eligible Benefits - Health, Dental, Vision
Employer Paid Life Insurance
401k
Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) Accruals
Paid Training
Career Path



Qualifications


Must use technology consistent with role (i.e. smartphone, computers, printers, copier machines, vehicles).
Is well organized and thorough.
Clearly understands issues and demonstrates a willingness and desire to follow through on what needs to be done.
Is responsible and dependable.
Is hard working and enthusiastic; fosters these attributes in others.
High School diploma or equivalent.
Valid South Carolina Drivers License required.



We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Experto
Description:
Buscamos Expertos en Creación de Contenidos en Inglés

En Tecmilenio, estamos conformando células de producción de contenidos orientadas a audiencias anglosajonas.

Para ello, buscamos profesionales nativos de países angloparlantes, con dominio pleno del idioma inglés (preferentemente inglés norteamericano) y experiencia comprobada en la creación y edición de materiales educativos y de formación.

Perfiles requeridos


Diseñadores Instruccionales
Con experiencia en el diseño de experiencias de aprendizaje, estructuración de cursos y creación de materiales digitales.
Editores de Estilo
Especialistas en garantizar claridad, coherencia, tono y calidad lingüística en inglés, con capacidad para adaptar mensajes a diferentes públicos.
Expertos de Contenido
Profesionales con conocimiento profundo en diversas áreas temáticas, capaces de generar materiales originales, actualizados y de alto valor.


✅ Requisitos


Ser nativo de lengua inglesa (preferentemente de EE.UU., Canadá u otros países angloparlantes).
Experiencia previa comprobable en el rol correspondiente.
Capacidad de trabajo remoto y colaboración en equipos multiculturales.
Atención al detalle y compromiso con la calidad.


Condiciones


Modalidad: Colaboración freelance o por proyecto.
Ubicación: Fuera de México (trabajo remoto desde países de origen angloparlante).
Inicio: Inmediato.
Facturación: Contar con régimen simplificado de confianza o con actividad empresarial


Postulación

Si cumples con el perfil, envíanos tu CV a: claribel.ta@tecmilenio.mx

Asunto: Células de producción – [Rol al que postulas]

Title: CTO- Healthcare AI-$300K base + 1–5% equity
Description:
A fast-growing healthcare AI company is building the AI-powered operating system for patient advocacy, transforming how patients navigate care. Backed by experienced founders, top investors, and advisors from tier-one health and tech companies, the team is scaling quickly with millions in revenue and 60%+ margins.




We’re looking for a hands-on CTO to:

Architect and ship patient- and advocate-facing applications, backend services, and AI integrations.
Build with Python, Django, Next.js, LLMs, vector databases, and RAG pipelines.
Stay 80%+ hands-on coding while hiring and mentoring engineers.
Work cross-functionally with clinical, ops, and growth teams to deliver value weekly.




What you’ll bring:

7–10+ years full-stack engineering, ideally in startups.
Experience in healthcare or regulated industries a plus.
A founder’s mindset: scrappy, bias to action, thrives in ambiguity.




Why join?

Mission-driven: transforming healthcare with AI.
High-ownership, fast-moving culture.
Competitive comp + founder-level equity.

Show more

Title: AI Software Engineer
Description:
Rattle is building the first AI-powered Revenue Intelligence Platform, solving the most critical problem in B2B sales: 75% of companies miss their revenue forecasts because the entire revenue tech stack depends on manual seller input and CRM guesswork.




The Problem We're Solving: Every Monday morning across 500,000 companies worldwide, revenue teams gather to answer three questions: Which deals will close? For how much? By when? This is solely based on the seller’s version of reality. Hence, revenue leaders spend more time inspecting deals than executing on them.




We're targeting the $2B+ forecasting market currently dominated by solutions that customers find disappointing due to their dependence on manual data hygiene. 




We are at an early stage of this product with a clear path to explosive growth, leveraging our experience & network in building Rattle over the last 5 years. Join us in eliminating the manual drudgery of revenue operations and building the future where forecasting is automatic, accurate, and actionable.




Backed by Tier-A investors, including Lightspeed, Insight Partners, Google Ventures, and Sequoia.




We're hiring for our San Francisco office - all positions require working in person.




This role is tailor-made for you if have

Built multi-agent systems with orchestration workers and smooth handoffs
Deep expertise in vector databases, matching algorithms, and preprocessing pipelines
Experience with Graph RAG and agent frameworks like LangGraph/Autogen
Codes daily and excited about 0→1 product development
Experience in scrappy early-stage startup environments
Shapes architecture and implementation decisions
Willing to dive deep into complex technical problems




We already like you if

You love Slack (we are a Slack-first company). You have been part of an early/mid-stage start-up before
You love TechCrunch. We are obsessed with reading and talking about startups
You have created some amazing open-source projects




More reasons to join us

Shape the culture: As an engineer here, you’ll be instrumental in building the culture with us
Have meaningful impact: Your work will enable 1000s of enterprise customers and millions of data requests per hour
Flexibility: You get to design your workday around your life - we believe in outcomes and not counting hours
Listen and be heard: We love feedback, we enjoy receiving and giving each other feedback, and we grow together
Show more

Title: LPC (Virtual)
Description:
LPC (Virtual) at Headway summary:

A Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) with a Master's degree or higher provides mental health counseling through private practice, facilitated by Headway's platform to accept insurance and increase access to care. The role involves managing a compliant, insurance-credentialed practice with built-in EHR features and continuing education support. This position aims to expand access to mental health services while improving provider earnings and practice management efficiency.

"

Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC)

Wage: Between $120-$131 an hour

Licensed Professional Counselor — Are you ready to launch or expand your private practice? Headway is here to help you start accepting insurance with ease, increase your earnings with higher rates, and start taking covered clients sooner. It’s all on one free-to-use platform, no commitment required.

About You


You’re a fully-licensed Professional Counselor at a Master’s level or above with LPC, LPCC, LCPC, LCPCS, LPCC-S licensure (accepted on a state by state basis), a valid NPI number, and malpractice insurance.
You’re ready to launch a private practice, or grow your existing business by taking insurance.


About Headway

Your expertise changes lives. Taking insurance makes it accessible to those who need it most. Every mental health provider who goes in-network with Headway supports people who’d otherwise be forced to choose between paying out of pocket, or not getting care at all. We make that process seamless — empowering you to accept insurance with ease, so you can do what you do best. So far, we’ve helped over 50,000 providers grow their practices, reaching countless people in need.

How Headway Supports Providers


Start taking insurance, stress-free: Get credentialed for free in multiple states in as little as 30 days and start seeing covered clients sooner.
Built-in compliance : Stay compliant from day one with audit support and ongoing resources.
Expansive coverage: Work with the plans that most clients use, including Medicare Advantage and Medicaid.
Increase your earnings: Secure higher rates with top insurance plans through access to our nationwide insurance network.
Dependable payments: Build stability in your practice with predictable bi-weekly payments you can count on.
Built-in EHR features : Manage your practice in one place with real-time scheduling, secure client messaging, end-to-end documentation templates, built-in assessments, and more.
Free continuing education : Nurture your long-term professional goals and earn CEUs with complimentary courses on Headway Academy.


How Headway Supports Your Clients


Increased access: Headway makes it easier for your clients to get the care they need at a price they can afford through insurance.
Instant verification: Clients can easily check their insurance status and get the care they need without disruption.


Please note: At this time, Headway can’t support mental health professionals that aren’t fully licensed. If your application was rejected for incomplete licensure, you’re welcome to reapply once you have a valid license.

"

Keywords:

Licensed Professional Counselor, mental health counseling, private practice, insurance credentialing, EHR management, continuing education, patient care accessibility, insurance billing, compliance support, telehealth
Show more

Title: Funded traineeship for young graduates at the EU Delegation to Mexico
Description:
PRINT

Funded traineeship for young graduates at the EU Delegation to Mexico

07.04.2025 Expired

Teaser

Are you a young graduate interested in international relations? Are you curious to learn more about work of a diplomatic mission and how the EU Delegation represents EU interests and values in Mexico?

Text

We Offer

A traineeshipof up to 6 months within the Political, Press and Information Section of the EU Delegation to Mexico, starting in July 2025.

Main Tasks


Daily monitoring of the Mexican media;
Contributing to political reporting on issues relevant for EU-Mexico relations (incl. bilateral, regional, global developments);
Conducting research and analysis of specific topic as needed and preparing speaking points for conferences, seminars etc.;
Supporting the organisation of visits or events in Mexico including public diplomacy activities;
Taking notes and reporting from EU coordination meetings or other meetings, in particular related to political, consular, cultural and human rights matters.


We Look For

Qualifications or special requirements:


Young BA graduates with at least relevant University degree, e.g. in international relations, political science or EU affairs. The selected candidate must present her/his diploma by the signature of the traineeship agreement at the latest and will have less than 1 year of professional experience on July 1st, 2025 ;
Very good command of Spanish and English (oral and written);
Ability to conduct political analysis of developing events;
Familiarity with Mexican/Latin American politics is preferable;
Ability to work with tight deadlines


How to apply?


Candidates must apply to the e-mail address DELEGATION-MEXICO-INTERNSHIP@eeas.europa.eu and send the following documents:
A detailed standard Europass curriculum vitae (CV) https://europass.cedefop.europa.eu/ (CVs in other format will not be considered)
a cover letter describing why you want to participate in a EU traineeship
and an application form (see below)


Application form for funded traineeships 2025.docx

Please mention in the subject of your e-mail: Funded Traineeship - Political, Press and Information Section

Important information to read before applying

Before applying you are requested to examine the dedicated website as well as the general eligibility criteria for a paid traineeship (Article 8 of the Decision ADMIN(2017)28 – Paid traineeship).

Each selected trainee will receive a monthly grant to cover living expenses. All costs related to travels, visa, insurance, accommodation must be borne by the trainee.

Applications from non-eligible candidates will not be considered. After the evaluation of all applications, shortlisted candidates will be contacted and invited for an interview. Unsuccessful candidates will be notified by email. In case the selected candidates are not able to present the required documents, their application will be rejected.

The traineeships can only be offered in compliance with the local legislation as well as the legislation of the country of origin.

Citizens From EU Member States


must provide proof that they will be covered against the risk of a pandemic and the costs of repatriation;
must hold a relevant entrance visa and / or temporary residence permit where applicable, based on the traineeship agreement, the duration of the traineeship, and in compliance with the local legislation.

Title: LPC (Virtual)
Description:
LPC (Virtual) at Headway summary:

A Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) with a Master's degree or higher provides mental health counseling through private practice, facilitated by Headway's platform to accept insurance and increase access to care. The role involves managing a compliant, insurance-credentialed practice with built-in EHR features and continuing education support. This position aims to expand access to mental health services while improving provider earnings and practice management efficiency.

"

Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC)

Wage: Between $120-$131 an hour

Licensed Professional Counselor — Are you ready to launch or expand your private practice? Headway is here to help you start accepting insurance with ease, increase your earnings with higher rates, and start taking covered clients sooner. It’s all on one free-to-use platform, no commitment required.

About You


You’re a fully-licensed Professional Counselor at a Master’s level or above with LPC, LPCC, LCPC, LCPCS, LPCC-S licensure (accepted on a state by state basis), a valid NPI number, and malpractice insurance.
You’re ready to launch a private practice, or grow your existing business by taking insurance.


About Headway

Your expertise changes lives. Taking insurance makes it accessible to those who need it most. Every mental health provider who goes in-network with Headway supports people who’d otherwise be forced to choose between paying out of pocket, or not getting care at all. We make that process seamless — empowering you to accept insurance with ease, so you can do what you do best. So far, we’ve helped over 50,000 providers grow their practices, reaching countless people in need.

How Headway Supports Providers


Start taking insurance, stress-free: Get credentialed for free in multiple states in as little as 30 days and start seeing covered clients sooner.
Built-in compliance : Stay compliant from day one with audit support and ongoing resources.
Expansive coverage: Work with the plans that most clients use, including Medicare Advantage and Medicaid.
Increase your earnings: Secure higher rates with top insurance plans through access to our nationwide insurance network.
Dependable payments: Build stability in your practice with predictable bi-weekly payments you can count on.
Built-in EHR features : Manage your practice in one place with real-time scheduling, secure client messaging, end-to-end documentation templates, built-in assessments, and more.
Free continuing education : Nurture your long-term professional goals and earn CEUs with complimentary courses on Headway Academy.


How Headway Supports Your Clients


Increased access: Headway makes it easier for your clients to get the care they need at a price they can afford through insurance.
Instant verification: Clients can easily check their insurance status and get the care they need without disruption.


Please note: At this time, Headway can’t support mental health professionals that aren’t fully licensed. If your application was rejected for incomplete licensure, you’re welcome to reapply once you have a valid license.

"

Keywords:

Licensed Professional Counselor, mental health counseling, private practice, insurance credentialing, EHR management, continuing education, patient care accessibility, insurance billing, compliance support, telehealth

Title: chemical laboratory analyst
Description:
Overview

Languages

English

Education


College, CEGEP or other non-university certificate or diploma from a program of 1 year to 2 years


Experience

1 year to less than 2 years

On site

Work must be completed at the physical location. There is no option to work remotely.

Employment groups

This employer promotes equal employment opportunities for all job applicants, including those self-identifying as a member of these groups:

Support for newcomers and refugees


Participates in a government or community program or initiative that supports newcomers and/or refugees
Assists with immediate settlement needs of newcomers and/or refugees (for example: housing, transportation, storage, childcare, winter clothing, etc.)
Supports social and labour market integration of newcomers and/or refugees (for example: facilitating access to community resources, language training, skills training, etc.)
Recruits newcomers and/or refugees who were displaced by a conflict or a natural disaster (for example: Ukraine, Afghanistan, etc.)
Supports newcomers and/or refugees with foreign credential recognition
Offers mentorship programs that pair newcomers and/or refugees with experienced employees
Provides diversity and cross-cultural trainings to create a welcoming work environment for newcomers and/or refugees


Support for Indigenous people


Participates in a government or community program or initiative that supports Indigenous people
Offers mentorship, coaching and/or networking opportunities for Indigenous workers
Develops and maintains relationships with indigenous communities, indigenous-owned businesses and organizations
Provides cultural competency training and/or awareness training to all employees to create a welcoming work environment for Indigenous workers
Facilitates access to Elders who can offer support and guidance to Indigenous workers


Support for mature workers


Participates in a government or community program or initiative that supports mature workers
Applies hiring policies that discourage age discrimination
Provides staff with awareness training to create a welcoming work environment for mature workers
Offers mentorship, coaching and/or networking opportunities for mature workers
Offers phased retirement options that allow mature workers to gradually reduce their workload (for example: flexible or reduced work hours, part time employment, project-based or seasonal work, etc.)
Offers phased re-entry options for mature workers who are returning to work after retiring (for example: gradually increasing hours and responsibilities)
Provides workspace accommodations, such as age-appropriate ergonomic considerations, to meet the physical needs of mature workers (for example: adjustable desks and chairs, accessible parking, etc.)
Offers resources to help mature workers plan their retirement (for example: financial planning, access to pension and benefits, lifestyle adjustments, etc.)

Title: Project Coordinator
Description:
About Us

James Fisher Technologies (JFT) is a reputable provider of remote solutions, specialty engineering, and technical services for applications within hazardous environments or with high integrity requirements. In other words, we get things done for the nuclear industry. Everyone at JFT has the chance to forge their career in an environment that values initiative, persistence, respect, curiosity, and passion.

We are looking for a Project Coordinator to join the team in our Loveland, CO office. The anticipated closing date for this posting is 9/30/25 and applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Function

The Project Coordinator collaborates with managers and clients to define project requirements, scopes, and objectives that align with the organization's goals. As Project Coordinator, you will coordinate both internal and external resources to ensure that projects stay on track in terms of scope, schedule, and budget. You'll also analyze project progress, adjusting scope or timelines when necessary to optimize outcomes. Additionally, you'll contribute to team development by sharing knowledge and building skill sets, all while working to meet organizational goals and adhering to best practices and standards.

Core Duties & Responsibilities


Support project managers by assisting in the creation of project management documents such as budgets, schedules, scope statements, and plans.
Monitor project progress, assess team performance, and provide regular updates to stakeholders.
Maintain clear communication with team members and clients to ensure project objectives are well understood.
Report potential risks and issues to project managers and escalate them when necessary.
Work to build strong relationships within the team to promote high morale.
Monitor daily project activities, ensuring team members have the necessary resources and supplies to meet their deadlines and budget requirements.
Organize important documents such as reports, invoices, and contracts for easy access.
Other responsibilities include performing billing and bookkeeping tasks, planning meetings and managing meeting minutes, tracking procurement status, assisting in production planning, and organizing project logistics.


Typical Working Conditions

Primarily an office environment with occasional exposure to the fabrication/machine shops. JFT has implemented a 9/80 work schedule and the office is closed every other Friday.

Physical Requirements

This position requires working on a computer, either standing or sitting, for most of the day and using standard office equipment. The ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing, with team members, customers, and vendors is essential. May occasionally lift and carry objects, typically under 25 pounds.

Qualifications And Experience


At least three years of experience in project coordination, including coordinating teams and working directly with clients.
Success in a corporate setting and the ability to interact with all levels of management is essential.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, are required, as are presentation skills.
A bachelor's degree in a relevant field is preferred, with engineering experience being a plus.
A professional certification such as PMP (Project Management Professional) is desirable.
The role may require working with export-controlled items.


James Fisher Technologies, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

JFT participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. JFT will not sponsor employment visas at this time.

A criminal history background check will be obtained pre-employment.

Title: Histology Laboratory Research Associate
Description:
Full-time


Company Description

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins works with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate. Eurofins believes it is a global leader in food, environmental, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies.

In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 47,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing

If you’re looking for a rewarding career, apply with us today!

Job Description

We are seeking a detail-oriented and collaborative Histology Laboratory Research Associate to support cutting-edge molecular pathology research. This role involves performing routine and advanced histology techniques, contributing to data acquisition and analysis, and working closely with cross-functional teams in a dynamic client-focused environment.

Key Responsibilities


Perform routine histology procedures including tissue processing, trimming, embedding, paraffin block microtomy, and cryo-sectioning.
Execute standard and specialized staining techniques such as H&E and special stains.
Conduct molecular pathology assays including immunohistochemistry (IHC), RNAscope, and multiplex staining using both automated platforms (Ventana, Leica) and manual methods.
Maintain and monitor laboratory equipment, ensuring accurate record-keeping and proper specimen archiving.
Analyze digital pathology images and generate quantitative data using software tools such as HALO and MATLAB.
Collaborate with board-certified anatomic pathologists to review and quality-check image analysis algorithms.
Adhere to good laboratory practices and maintain high standards of documentation and data integrity.


Qualifications

Education & Experience:


Bachelor’s degree in biological sciences with 3–4 years of relevant experience, or
Master’s degree with 1–2 years of experience in a research or pharmaceutical histology lab.


Skills & Knowledge


Proficiency in histology techniques including tissue processing and staining.
Familiarity with digital pathology platforms and image analysis tools is preferred.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


Additional Requirements


ASCP certification (HT or HTL) preferred.
Must be authorized to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship.


Additional Information

What To Expect In The Hiring Process


10-15 Minute Phone Interview with Region Recruiter
45-60 Minute Virtual Interview with Manager and/or Group Leader
45-60 Minute Onsite Meeting with the Team


Additional Details

The position is onsite, full-time, Monday through Friday, from 8 am to 5 pm, with overtime as needed. Candidates living within a commutable distance of Boston, MA, and the surrounding areas are encouraged to apply.

Excellent Full-time Benefits Include


Hourly Compensation: $36-$42, depending on education and experience
Estimated Annual Salary: $74,880 – $87,360
Medical Coverage: Comprehensive medical insurance options
Dental & Vision: Full dental and vision coverage available
Life & Disability Insurance: Employer-sponsored plans
Retirement: 401(k) plan with company match
Paid Time Off: Vacation days, paid holidays, and additional PTO options

Eurofins Lancaster Laboratories Professional Scientific Services® (PSS) is a global, award-winning insourcing solution that places our people at our clients’ sites, dedicated to running and managing laboratory services while eliminating headcount, co-employment, and project-management worries.

We infuse our 55-year track record of scientific and laboratory operations expertise, as well as HR, and a great place to work best practices, to recruit, hire, train, and manage highly qualified scientists to perform laboratory services using our client’s quality systems and equipment.

To learn more about Eurofins Lancaster Laboratories, please explore our website www.eurofinsus.com.

Eurofins USA PSS Insourcing Solutions is a Disabled and Veteran Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

Title: Desarrollador de Mercado
Description:
En BayWa r.e. buscamos a un profesional estratégico, orientado a resultados y con gran capacidad de gestión y negociación, para impulsar el crecimiento de novotegra, nuestra línea de sistemas de montaje solar.

Lo que harás en tu día a día

Tu Misión

Dar seguimiento ágil y preciso a incidencias logísticas, conectando al equipo comercial con Generar y mantener relaciones comerciales sólidas con clientes nuevos y existentes, brindando asesoría técnica y comercial, y asegurando experiencias positivas en todo el proceso de venta.

✨ Lo Que Harás


Desarrollar demanda y oportunidades de negocio para novotegra.
Brindar soporte técnico y comercial a clientes y al equipo interno.
Participar en actividades de marketing, capacitaciones y eventos.
Elaborar reportes estratégicos que apoyen la toma de decisiones.


️ Lo Que Buscamos


Licenciatura en Ingeniería Civil o similar.
Experiencia mínima de 2 años en ventas consultivas (modelo mayorista deseable).
Conocimientos en sistemas solares y estructuras.
Excel avanzado, AutoCAD (deseable) y CRM (deseable).
Inglés intermedio.
Disponibilidad para viajar.


Competencias clave

Visión estratégica, negociación, comunicación efectiva, organización, capacidad analítica y habilidades interpersonales avanzadas.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Horario: Lunes a viernes, 9:00 am a 6:00 pm. Esquema de trabajo hibrido.

Sueldo competitivo + prestaciones superiores a las de la ley.

Un ambiente de trabajo colaborativo y lleno de oportunidades para crecer.

¿Si te gustó lo que leíste y crees que tu perfil hace match con la vacante, ¡Queremos conocerte!

Title: Clinical Research Coordinator- Div Gen Int Medicine
Description:
Description

Job Description

The Clinical Research Coordinator is an entry human subjects researcher, responsible for conducting and assisting in clinical research studies under the supervision of the Principal Investigator or senior clinical research staff. This individual obtains informed consent, collects, maintains and organizes study information. Assists in the preparation and submission of grant applications and documents (e.g., Institutional Review Board, Grants and Contracts Office).

The grant funding for this position is expected to continue through 2025.

Responsibilities


Conducts routine and standardized human subjects research using appropriate research or interview techniques specific to subject matter of the research project, under direct supervision of the Principal Investigator or senior clinical research staff.
Assists in the activities related to clinical research including, but not limited to: obtaining informed consent, screening participants for eligibility, registering patients with sponsoring agencies, administering questionnaires and answering telephone calls.
Assists in the collection, analysis and review of experimental data for publication and presentation.
Maintains source documents and subject files in accordance with Mount Sinai policies and procedures. Ensures accurate, confidential and complete compilation of data.
May secure and ship clinical specimens as required by the protocol.
May assist in the preparation for regulatory agency site visits.
Performs other related duties.


Qualifications


Bachelors degree in science or related field preferred or a combination of relevant research experience and education
0-2 years of research/human subjects experience


Employer Description

Strength through Unity and Inclusion

The Mount Sinai Health System is committed to fostering an environment where everyone can contribute to excellence. We share a common dedication to delivering outstanding patient care. When you join us, you become part of Mount Sinai’s unparalleled legacy of achievement, education, and innovation as we work together to transform healthcare. We encourage all team members to actively participate in creating a culture that ensures fair access to opportunities, promotes inclusive practices, and supports the success of every individual.

At Mount Sinai, our leaders are committed to fostering a workplace where all employees feel valued, respected, and empowered to grow. We strive to create an environment where collaboration, fairness, and continuous learning drive positive change, improving the well-being of our staff, patients, and organization. Our leaders are expected to challenge outdated practices, promote a culture of respect, and work toward meaningful improvements that enhance patient care and workplace experiences. We are dedicated to building a supportive and welcoming environment where everyone has the opportunity to thrive and advance professionally. Explore this opportunity and be part of the next chapter in our history.

About The Mount Sinai Health System

Mount Sinai Health System is one of the largest academic medical systems in the New York metro area, with more than 48,000 employees working across eight hospitals, more than 400 outpatient practices, more than 300 labs, a school of nursing, and a leading school of medicine and graduate education. Mount Sinai advances health for all people, everywhere, by taking on the most complex health care challenges of our time — discovering and applying new scientific learning and knowledge; developing safer, more effective treatments; educating the next generation of medical leaders and innovators; and supporting local communities by delivering high-quality care to all who need it. Through the integration of its hospitals, labs, and schools, Mount Sinai offers comprehensive health care solutions from birth through geriatrics, leveraging innovative approaches such as artificial intelligence and informatics while keeping patients’ medical and emotional needs at the center of all treatment. The Health System includes more than 9,000 primary and specialty care physicians; 13 joint-venture outpatient surgery centers throughout the five boroughs of New York City, Westchester, Long Island, and Florida; and more than 30 affiliated community health centers. We are consistently ranked by U.S. News & World Report's Best Hospitals, receiving high "Honor Roll" status, and are highly ranked: No. 1 in Geriatrics, top 5 in Cardiology/Heart Surgery, and top 20 in Diabetes/Endocrinology, Gastroenterology/GI Surgery, Neurology/Neurosurgery, Orthopedics, Pulmonology/Lung Surgery, Rehabilitation, and Urology. New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai is ranked No. 12 in Ophthalmology. U.S. News & World Report’s “Best Children’s Hospitals” ranks Mount Sinai Kravis Children's Hospital among the country’s best in several pediatric specialties. The Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai is ranked No. 11 nationwide in National Institutes of Health funding and in the 99th percentile in research dollars per investigator according to the Association of American Medical Colleges. Newsweek’s “The World’s Best Smart Hospitals” ranks The Mount Sinai Hospital as No. 1 in New York and in the top five globally, and Mount Sinai Morningside in the top 20 globally.

Equal Opportunity Employer

The Mount Sinai Health System is an equal opportunity employer, complying with all applicable federal civil rights laws. We do not discriminate, exclude, or treat individuals differently based on race, color, national origin, age, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are deeply committed to fostering an environment where all faculty, staff, students, trainees, patients, visitors, and the communities we serve feel respected and supported. Our goal is to create a healthcare and learning institution that actively works to remove barriers, address challenges, and promote fairness in all aspects of our organization.

Compensation

The Mount Sinai Health System (MSHS) provides salary ranges that comply with the New York City Law on Salary Transparency in Job Advertisements. The salary range for the role is $16.5 - $39.4984 Hourly. Actual salaries depend on a variety of factors, including experience, education, and operational need. The salary range or contractual rate listed does not include bonuses/incentive, differential pay or other forms of compensation or benefits.

Compensation

The Mount Sinai Health System (MSHS) provides salary ranges that comply with the New York City Law on Salary Transparency in Job Advertisements. Title: LPC (Virtual)
Description:
LPC (Virtual) at Headway summary:

A Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) with a Master's degree or higher providing mental health counseling services, specializing in growing or launching private practices by accepting insurance through the Headway platform. The role involves credentialing with insurance plans, managing compliance, and using integrated EHR tools to increase accessibility and improve client care. This position supports providers in expanding their practice while ensuring clients receive affordable, insured mental health services.

"

Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC)

Wage: Between $120-$131 an hour

Licensed Professional Counselor — Are you ready to launch or expand your private practice? Headway is here to help you start accepting insurance with ease, increase your earnings with higher rates, and start taking covered clients sooner. It’s all on one free-to-use platform, no commitment required.

About You


You’re a fully-licensed Professional Counselor at a Master’s level or above with LPC, LPCC, LCPC, LCPCS, LPCC-S licensure (accepted on a state by state basis), a valid NPI number, and malpractice insurance.
You’re ready to launch a private practice, or grow your existing business by taking insurance.


About Headway

Your expertise changes lives. Taking insurance makes it accessible to those who need it most. Every mental health provider who goes in-network with Headway supports people who’d otherwise be forced to choose between paying out of pocket, or not getting care at all. We make that process seamless — empowering you to accept insurance with ease, so you can do what you do best. So far, we’ve helped over 50,000 providers grow their practices, reaching countless people in need.

How Headway Supports Providers


Start taking insurance, stress-free: Get credentialed for free in multiple states in as little as 30 days and start seeing covered clients sooner.
Built-in compliance : Stay compliant from day one with audit support and ongoing resources.
Expansive coverage: Work with the plans that most clients use, including Medicare Advantage and Medicaid.
Increase your earnings: Secure higher rates with top insurance plans through access to our nationwide insurance network.
Dependable payments: Build stability in your practice with predictable bi-weekly payments you can count on.
Built-in EHR features : Manage your practice in one place with real-time scheduling, secure client messaging, end-to-end documentation templates, built-in assessments, and more.
Free continuing education : Nurture your long-term professional goals and earn CEUs with complimentary courses on Headway Academy.


How Headway Supports Your Clients


Increased access: Headway makes it easier for your clients to get the care they need at a price they can afford through insurance.
Instant verification: Clients can easily check their insurance status and get the care they need without disruption.

Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC)

 Wage: Between $120-$131 an hour

Licensed Professional Counselor — Are you ready to launch or expand your private practice? Headway is here to help you start accepting insurance with ease, increase your earnings with higher rates, and start taking covered clients sooner. It’s all on one free-to-use platform, no commitment required.

About You

  • You’re a fully-licensed Professional Counselor at a Master’s level or above with LPC, LPCC, LCPC, LCPCS, LPCC-S licensure (accepted on a state by state basis), a valid NPI number, and malpractice insurance.
  • You’re ready to launch a private practice, or grow your existing business by taking insurance.

About Headway

Your expertise changes lives. Taking insurance makes it accessible to those who need it most. Every mental health provider who goes in-network with Headway supports people who’d otherwise be forced to choose between paying out of pocket, or not getting care at all. We make that process seamless — empowering you to accept insurance with ease, so you can do what you do best. So far, we’ve helped over 50,000 providers grow their practices, reaching countless people in need.

How Headway Supports Providers

  • Start taking insurance, stress-free: Get credentialed for free in multiple states in as little as 30 days and start seeing covered clients sooner.
  • Built-in compliance : Stay compliant from day one with audit support and ongoing resources.
  • Expansive coverage: Work with the plans that most clients use, including Medicare Advantage and Medicaid.
  • Increase your earnings: Secure higher rates with top insurance plans through access to our nationwide insurance network.
  • Dependable payments: Build stability in your practice with predictable bi-weekly payments you can count on.
  • Built-in EHR features : Manage your practice in one place with real-time scheduling, secure client messaging, end-to-end documentation templates, built-in assessments, and more.
  • Free continuing education : Nurture your long-term professional goals and earn CEUs with complimentary courses on Headway Academy.

How Headway Supports Your Clients

  • Increased access: Headway makes it easier for your clients to get the care they need at a price they can afford through insurance.
  • Instant verification: Clients can easily check their insurance status and get the care they need without disruption.

Please note: At this time, Headway can’t support mental health professionals that aren’t fully licensed. If your application was rejected for incomplete licensure, you’re welcome to reapply once you have a valid license.
